publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3129 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Multiple Sclerosis Researchâ€”That the Parliament acknowledges the fact that Scotland has the highest rates of multiple sclerosis in the world, with over 10,500 people currently affected; recognises the pain and distress this disease causes to both those affected and their families; acknowledges and fully supports the hard work undertaken by the many charities in this field, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make a commitment to invest in research into multiple sclerosis and further to invest in support for those affected and their families as a matter of priority.
S2M-3129 Multiple Sclerosis Research (lodged on 28 July 2005) Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-3129 Multiple Sclerosis Research (lodged on 28 July 2005) Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-3129 Multiple Sclerosis Research (lodged on 28 July 2005) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-3129 Multiple Sclerosis Research (lodged on 28 July 2005) Elaine Smith*
